name: Catmint
climate: Catmint thrives in temperate climates with moderate seasonal variations.
This plant prefers a dry or semi-arid environment, avoiding excess moisture.
It can tolerate cooler climates but not extremely cold or freezing conditions.
Ideal conditions mimic Mediterranean climates with warm, dry summers.
sunlight: Catmint requires full sunlight for optimal growth and blooming.
While it prefers full sun, it can also grow in partial shade if necessary.
Ensure the plant receives at least six hours of direct sunlight daily.
Avoid locations with too much shade as it may hinder flower production.
watering: Water the catmint moderately, ensuring the soil does not become soaked.
Allow the soil to dry slightly between watering to prevent root rot.
In hot summers, frequent watering may be necessary to keep it healthy.
Overwatering is more detrimental than underwatering; err on the dry side.
soil: Catmint thrives in well-draining soil with a gritty or sandy texture.
The soil should ideally be slightly alkaline to neutral for best results.
Heavily compacted soil should be avoided to ensure optimal root growth.
It is tolerant of poorer soils but enrich with organic matter occasionally.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning after blooming encourages bushier growth and more flowers.
